alert.note: Alert for Shannon; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:00AM CST until December 20 at 6:30AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following counties, Howell, Oregon, Shannon and Texas. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 159 AM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... North Prong Jacks Fork at Arroll Road, Carr Creek at Highway HH, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road, Mahans Creek at County Road 501 and Rocky Creek at Highway NN. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mountain View, Willow Springs, Winona, Birch Tree, Eminence, Summersville, Pomona and Montier. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
